title: Trump Hosts Zelenskyy at White House to Discuss Ukraine War Resolution
snippets: US president proposes Putin-Zelenskyy summit in latest push to end the war in Ukraine.
President Trump has downplayed the need for a ceasefire agreement, but if there isn't a one "before those peace agreement talks, then the killing will just keep going," ABC News' Martha Raddatz says.
A repeated refrain from European leaders during remarks ahead of their meeting was the need for security guarantees for Ukraine.
The high-stakes gathering comes as Trump presses for a peace deal to end the war in Ukraine after Russia launched its full-scale invasion in 2022.
The leaders presented a relatively united front and appeared to agree on the next steps in the effort to halt the fighting between Ukraine and Russia. But much remained unresolved.
titles: What to know about Trump’s talks with Zelenskyy and European leaders
WATCH:  President Trump meets with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders
WATCH:  President Trump pressed on security guarantees for Ukraine
What to expect as Zelensky, European leaders meet Trump at White House
5 Takeaways From Trump’s Meeting With Zelensky and European Leaders
summary: President Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the White House, aiming to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine. Despite Trump's minimal emphasis on a ceasefire, ABC News' Martha Raddatz highlighted its necessity to halt ongoing violence prior to peace talks. This significant meeting occurred six months after a previous diplomatic mishap in February, marking a warm reception between the leaders as they seek a resolution to the conflict.

title: SoftBank Buys $2B in Intel Stock Amid AI Market Challenges
snippets: Investors are also looking ahead to the U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's annual speech at the central bank's summit in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.
SoftBank will pay $23 per share for Intel's common stock, acquiring roughly 2% of the struggling chipmaker.
The U.S. chipmaker has struggled to keep pace in the AI market alongside competitors like Nvidia. Softbank has agreed to buy Intel common stock at $23 per share.
SoftBank agreed to acquire $2 billion worth of stock in beleaguered chipmaker Intel as the Japanese conglomerate continues to deepen its investment in the U.S.
Intel is getting a $2 billion investment in common stock from SoftBank, which is betting big on the AI revolution.
Intel Corp. shares jumped in after-hours trading Monday after the chipmaker announced a $2 billion investment by Japan’s SoftBank Group Corp.

BANGKOK (AP) — Japanese technology giant SoftBank Group plans to take a $2 billion stake in computer chip maker Intel as it deepens its involvement in U.S. semiconductor manufacturing and other advanced technology in the United States, the companies said Monday. Shares in SoftBank fell 4% Tues
SoftBank will pay $23 per share for Intel common stock.
titles: SoftBank shares fall over 5% after it announces $2 billion investment in Intel
Intel is getting a $2 billion investment from SoftBank
Japanese tech investment giant SoftBank to invest $2 billion in Intel
SoftBank To Make $2 Billion Investment In Troubled U.S. Chipmaker Intel
SoftBank is investing $2 billion in Intel as part of its AI bet
Intel’s stock rallies after $2 billion investment by Japan’s SoftBank
Japan’s SoftBank to take $2 billion stake in computer chip maker Intel
SoftBank makes $2B investment in Intel
summary: SoftBank has agreed to purchase $2 billion worth of Intel's common stock at $23 per share, acquiring approximately 2% of the chipmaker. This investment comes as Intel faces challenges in the AI market, particularly against competitors like Nvidia. The announcement of this deal led to an increase in Intel Corp. shares in after-hours trading. This move signifies SoftBank's continued investment in U.S. semiconductor manufacturing and advanced technology sectors.

title: Zelenskyy, Trump Discuss Russia War, Seek Diplomatic Solutions

Trump also called Putin to arrange talks, signaling efforts to address the conflict directly. The meeting, which included European leaders, aimed to ensure the trans-Atlantic alliance's unity amidst the ongoing situation with Russia.

title: Hamas Agrees to Ceasefire, Hostage Release in 60-Day Deal

This event marks a significant moment in the ongoing rivalry between Alcaraz and Sinner, although this match did not live up to the epic encounters expected by fans.

title: Bogaerts' HR Overturned for Fan Interference, Padres Manager Ejected

Xander Bogaerts of the San Diego Padres had a home run overturned due to fan interference and manager Mike Shildt was ejected for coming out of the dugout to talk to the umpires in the second inning of Monday night’s game against the San Francisco Giants.

Padres manager Mike Shildt was ejected for disputing the call with umpires in the second inning. The incident occurred during the Padres' 4-3 loss on Monday night.

Trump's discussions with Zelenskyy come after he met with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday.

summary: President Donald Trump discussed security guarantees for Ukraine in the Oval Office, following his recent meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Trump mentioned that after his upcoming meeting with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, a trilateral meeting (Trilat) involving himself, Zelenskyy, and Putin will occur. This aims to address security concerns involving the U.S. and Ukraine.

title: Iga Swiatek Wins Cincinnati Open, Eyes US Open After Wimbledon Victory
snippets: Swiatek captured her first Cincinnati Open title without losing a set after beating Jasmine Paolini in the final
World number three Iga Swiatek said triumph at the Cincinnati Open gives her a "boost of confidence" before the US Open begins on Sunday.

Iga Swiatek warmed up for the US Open by winning the Cincinnati Open for the first time and will now turn her attentions to securing back-to-back Grand Slam titles after her Wimbledon triumph in July.
Third-ranked Iga Swiatek captured the Cincinnati Open title by defeating No. 7 Jasmine Paolini 7-5, 6-4 on Monday night.

Ranked third in the world, Swiatek's victory boosts her confidence ahead of the US Open, following her recent Wimbledon triumph. She aims for consecutive Grand Slam titles.

title: Newsmax Pays $67M to Settle Dominion Defamation Lawsuit
snippets: Newsmax has paid $27m so far, and will pay $20m in 2026 and $20m in 2027 to technology firm Dominion Voting Systems.

DENVER (AP) — The conservative network Newsmax will pay $67 million to settle a lawsuit accusing it of defaming a voting equipment company by spreading lies about President Donald Trump’s 2020 election loss, according to documents filed Monday. The settlement comes after Fox News Channel paid $787.5
titles: Right-wing US network Newsmax to pay $67m over false 2020 election claims

summary: Newsmax has agreed to pay $67 million to settle a defamation lawsuit with Dominion Voting Systems. The lawsuit accused Newsmax of spreading false claims about the 2020 presidential election. The settlement includes payments of $27 million already made, with additional payments scheduled for 2026 and 2027. This follows a similar lawsuit in which Fox News Channel paid $787.5 million.

This push for support comes as Ukraine seeks to bolster its defenses against ongoing aggression.

Unlike traditional vaccines designed to target specific tumor proteins, this approach simply revs u

summary: A new mRNA cancer vaccine has demonstrated potential in mice studies to enhance immunotherapy effectiveness, offering hope for a universal treatment against various cancers. This innovative vaccine differs from traditional ones by not targeting specific tumor proteins but instead boosting the body's immune response to fight cancer more effectively.

title: 1950s-60s US Colleges Embrace Coeducation, Marking Social Shift
snippets: In response to shifting gender norms and post-war social movements, many U.S. colleges and universities began admitting women in the 1950s and '60s. The coeducational movement, which started in the early 19th century, sparked innovations in education, labor, and civil rights in the United States.

This movement, rooted in the early 19th century, led to notable advancements in education, labor, and civil rights across the United States.

title: Exascale Supercomputers Enhance Earthquake Simulation Accuracy
snippets: Simulations still can't predict exactly when an earthquake will happen, but with the incredible processing power of modern exascale supercomputers, they can now predict how they will happen and how much damage they will likely cause.
titles: Exascale simulations underpin quake-resistant infrastructure designs
summary: Using the advanced processing capabilities of exascale supercomputers, scientists have improved earthquake simulations. While these simulations cannot determine the precise timing of an earthquake, they can now more accurately predict the manner in which earthquakes will occur and estimate the potential damage they may cause.

title: Study: High Sensitivity Linked to Greater Therapy Benefit, Risk of Depression
snippets: Researchers analyzing 33 studies found strong evidence that highly sensitive people are more prone to depression and anxiety but also more likely to benefit from therapy. Since about 31% of the population is highly sensitive, experts argue that clinicians should consider sensitivity levels when diag
titles: This overlooked trait could explain anxiety and depression in millions
summary: Researchers reviewing 33 studies discovered that highly sensitive individuals, making up approximately 31% of the population, are more susceptible to depression and anxiety. However, they also respond better to therapy. This finding suggests that clinicians should take into account a person's sensitivity level during diagnosis and treatment planning to effectively address mental health issues.

title: Texas attorney general accuses Meta, Character.AI of misleading kids with mental health claims
snippets: Texas attorney general Ken Paxton is investigating Meta and CharacterAI over claims they deceptively market chatbots as mental health tools, raising concerns about child safety, data privacy, and targeted advertising.
